title: Executive Order 5150-Authorizing the Reinstatement of Mae A. Krigbaum Without Regard to Civil Service Rules
content: Mrs. Mae A. Krigbaum may be reinstated as an operative in the Bureau of Engraving and Printing without regard to the length of her separation from the service. She was appointed and served thru competitive examination as printer's assistant, from June, 1902, to February, 1905. She is the widow of Samuel Krigbaum who died December 19, 1928, after serving as plate printer in the Bureau for over twenty-six years, leaving his widow with a house and a small insurance which is nearly gone, and three dependent children of 18, 16, and 12 years, the oldest, a boy, being in poor health.
The Secretary of the Treasury recommends this order.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5150-Authorizing the Reinstatement of Mae A. Krigbaum Without Regard to Civil Service Rules Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/360849
